title: How important is quickcast?
body:
I main Thresh and I know for fact that it's better not to have quickcast enabled for him. But for almost all my other mains (Ezreal, Amumu, Caitlyn, Braum, Shen, Garen, Lee Sin...) I hear it's better to use quickcast. 

How badly is quickcast holding me back? Will turning on quickcast give me a big advantage at Silver 5 level? It is really not possible to make gold teir without quickcasting?

TL;DR
Is not using quickcast holding me back?

replies.body:
Well with thresh if you E on the spot then Q it removes the wind up time of his Q which can be beneficial situationally and if you're not using Quickcast that's - E left click Q left click meanwhile having to aim which in the space of a few milliseconds isn't as fast as Smart casting.

I use it on everyone except Vi Q because it has a charge up time and cant be smart cast, other than that I really think its better with everyone and its not that hard to know Champions ranges on skills because realistically you need to know the AOE range of abilities to be able to land them and skillshots aren't really much different and once you're comfortable you can easily do an E-W-R Combo with AP Ezreal and do so faster than if you don't smart cast making being a formidable opponent much easier than if you are click casting skills so I think it's better.

I see pros that don't use quick casting sometimes though preferring to have constant reminders of their ranges etc I just think one you've got the Champs down pat or are familiar with everyone you don't need range indicators. I mean who checks range indicators on Renektons Q before casting it? No one - they can tell the range and telling the range of skillshots like Jinx's Zap etc isn't really any different and if you are smart-casting you are essentially able to cast and combo skills far faster and the more skills you have to chain IMO the more important and beneficial it is to be able to smart cast.

The difference is only minor though so it shouldn't really effect you that much but it does affect clutches and combos etc and can be game-changing.
Really? I thought Varus Q, Xerath Q and Vi Q all worked the same?
Yeah forgot to mention them but I don't really play them that often but yeah they work the same as in you can't smart cast their Q's cause if you do it doesn't power up.

They do power up. 
I play quickcast on all except Vi because I've never played Vi. If you hold the key down they power up.

Oh ok didn't know this lol.

I wouldn't use it on smartcast (Vi's Q) or Varus Q though because I'd rather be able to pop potions during fights and I use pinky on Q and can't really hit 1 with other fingers so I wouldn't be able to pop potions while charging Q whereas I can if I turn off Smartcast for it and use Q to begin charging it - situations arise.
I always have potions on 3 or 4 for that reason lol
I was going to tell him that

I actually didn't see that part about the animation cancel, as a Thresh main I've done some research into the infamous "animation cancel with e". It's complete bull shit, I hear it just looks faster, the actual animation is not. Confirmed by Riot FeralPony http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1n69lg/thresh_hook_trick/

>I main Thresh and I know for fact that it's better not to have quickcast enabled for him.

This is a load of crap.

Quick cast better's every ability in the game, no exceptions, the one thing you have to do if your less confident is hold the button with the range indicators enabled (this is a separate setting) and you get the same thing as without quick cast on, but as soon as you let go it's cast instead of a left click, and a right click disables it.

No ability shouldn't have quick cast, because no ability actually benefits from the longer time spent casting.

>Will turning on quickcast give me a big advantage at Silver 5 level? It is really not possible to make gold teir without quickcasting?

Everyone else uses quick cast (or at least the vast majority of players) so you don't gain a "big advantage" rather remove a small disadvantage you've placed on yourself.

And it's possible to climb with quickcasting off, however you learn to be more autonomous with quick cast turned on (meaning you do the necessary thinking without actually thinking about it)

I have seen a j4 "slingshot" gank which was enabled because of the delay from normal casting.

Just saying
That doesnt make any sense. You could do the same thing with quickcast by just pressing the button slightly later

I have a question about quickcasting. If you're zed for example and you want to hit them with q, although because they are moving left you place it slightly left of them with normal cast... but if you were using quickcast you would miss most of the time??? wouldn't you?
because when you quickcast, does it not go to their position AT THE START of when you casted?
as soon as you hit the key it casts
Your not using a point and click ability.
You get used to casting skills slightly faster and aim slightly closer than if you were click casting (slightly less ahead of them to compensate for their movement).
I see, thanks.

Honestly, you should use what feels right to you. 
Some people might disagree with me, but I personally can't stand quick cast.

I tried it a few times, but I just couldn't get used to it. I made it to Gold without it. I'm almost Plat now.

Like you stated, not all champs are good with it. Anyway, in my opinion, I don't think it's holding you back (especially if you don't feel comfortable using it).
I got used to quickcasting by playing yasuo at levels 24-27 (his q is auto quick cast) and I find I just don't play without it
Thanks for the advice everyone. I think I'll try using quickcast on all the champions I can, maybe even Thresh ;)
